instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01949: What is 820-01949? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot to HD
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> it turns on see logo then hard drive when you boot to hd it shuts of it can go to dfu but every time i restore or recovery it fails it run off battery or charger
off charger i get 19.1v 2.01A

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot to HD
threads.message:
Change security settings accordingly and try to boot USB macOS for test.
Also test starting in safe mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot to HD
threads.message: it will not boot to recovery when it down load it when finish it keeps rebooting i tried DFU AND the same thing

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot to HD
threads.message:
You may have a problem with internal SSD.
Can you start it in Target Disk mode?
What error do you get on DFU?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot to HD
threads.message: when i boot with option i see hard drive logo but when i choose it it then reboot

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot to HD
threads.message:
"What error do you get on DFU?"
Did you complete DFU, or got error?
